alert.note: Alert for Christian; Hopkins (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 4:10AM EDT until August 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Hopkins County in northwestern Kentucky... Northern Christian County in south central Kentucky... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 310 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nortonville and White Plains. This includes the following highways... Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 43. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 25 and 34. Interstate 69 in Kentucky near Mile Marker 106. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
